# isVideoMirrored

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection horizontally flips the video flowing through it.

## Declaration

```swift
var isVideoMirrored: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can apply a mirror-image effect to a video flowing through the connection by setting the value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. The mirroring effect only applies to video or depth connections, similar to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureConnection/videoRotationAngle], and if [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureConnection/isVideoMirroringSupported] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

Not all capture connections mirror each frame. For example, a video connection to an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureMovieFileOutput] or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCapturePhotoOutput] instance applies the mirror effect with a QuickTime track matrix or with EXIF tags, respectively.

Capture connections to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutput] and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDepthDataOutput] instances mirror video frames they provide to their [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutputSampleBufferDelegate/captureOutput(_:didOutput:from:)] and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDepthDataOutputDelegate/depthDataOutput(_:didOutput:timestamp:connection:)] delegate methods, respectively. Each [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoDataOutput] instance uses hardware acceleration to mirror every frame.



You can mirror the video of a movie file you record with an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriter] instance by applying a scale factor to the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriterInput/transform] property of its [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVAssetWriterInput]. For example, you can horizontally flip an image by scaling the x-axis by `-1`. This approach avoids the performance costs that come with rotating each video frame.

```swift
func horizontallyFlipInput(_ assetInput: AVAssetWriterInput) {
    let horiztonalFlip = CGAffineTransform(scaleX: -1.0, y: 1.0)

    assetInput.transform = assetInput.transform.concatenating(horiztonalFlip)
}
```

## Mirroring a video

- **isVideoMirroringSupported**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the connection supports video mirroring.
- **automaticallyAdjustsVideoMirroring**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can enable mirroring based on a session’s configuration.
